name: St. Emilianus of Dacia
summary: Emilianus was a Christian martyr who died in Dacia (modern Romania) during the persecution of Julian the Apostate. According to tradition, he was a Roman soldier who converted to Christianity and was martyred for his faith. He is venerated as a saint and is one of the early Christian martyrs from the region that would become Romania, demonstrating the spread of Christianity to the Danube frontier.
